title: Have you ever gotten a speeding ticket? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, once about 5….6 years ago. I was driving my wife home from an interview, and as she was dressed quite nice and elegant, more than the usual, and somehow my “alpha male” instincts kicked in and I wanted to pass a car in front of me that was going rather slow (for a BMW that is….). So I got caught with just a little bit over the speed limit and I felt like the noobest of the noobs. I think even the policeman had a good laugh. I was caught doing 62km/h in a area where 50km/h is the limit. And in Romania, a tolerance of +/- 10km/h around the speed limit is tolerated. So if I would have managed to slow down to 59km/h, I would not have been stopped or just received a warning… And surprisingly enough, I did not get a lecture from my wife, as she clearly understood what happened to me. I keep peeking at her while driving on the way home in a way she haven’t seen me doing in years. She took it as a compliment, reminded me to pay the fine within 48 hours so I could pay only half of it, and never again mentioned it. In Romania, getting a speeding ticket doesn’t affect you in any way other than having to pay the fine and getting some points off. Point that will be reset if 6 months pass without any other mistake. There’s no history of these events than can affect your life in any way. OK, unpaid fines can give you some troubles in the long run, but nothing that serious. And to make the situation even more clear, this happened when our first child was about two years old and my wife had finished her paid maternity leave. Those first two years were quite a struggle for us as we had a lot of health problems with our son, so we quite neglected ourselves. So, me ogling at her like I did that day and trying to act all macho (well, to the extent my behavior can be called macho…) was a much needed compliment and was well received. She did not have to spell this out for me, I managed to read between the line. And yes, some 3 months later she got the job she interviewed for. I know, 3 months is a long time, but better late than never.

Yes many of them! My 1st one was kind of funny! I got pulled over! I was nervous as get out! The cop approaches asks to see my driver’s license and registration. I hand the cop my whole wallet! He says take your driver’s license out. I am going oh GoodGod really. I can’t think clearly! Hand him my everything! He comes back and gives it to me and the ticket. Few days later I am on AOL chats in my city. I start talking to this person, and he said he was in public service. I said you must be this or that. He told me his name… I was like oh your the jerk who gave me a speeding ticket. He than said I should goto court. I said who has time for that. I had already paid the fine. My most recent speeding ticket was clearly me not speeding. I was coming home from the hospital with my dad. State Trooper was ahead of me and after another white vehicle. I had speed control set to 65! He drops back and pulls me over, I said can I help you? He said license and registration you were doing 85 in a 65! I looked at him like really? when he handed me the ticket and my stuff back he was gone! I couldn’t ask any questions. Went to court in this county that only holds traffic court on Fridays. The line was out the building wrapped around the building! I was like great! 25,000 cases that day! I said great! We get in the court hall way waiting area. It was booked solid. You couldn’t hear your name or anything being called. I asked for a PFJ! Had to continue my date to another day. Came back a few weeks later. They dropped it down to faulty equipment. No fine, just court costs. Thank you Cabarrus County, worst court for traffic court in NC! I avoidCabarrus like the plague now!

Yes, but just one. I was a part of a group that ran a program at a retreat center about four time a year. Normally, once we are at the center, the people involved in running the program do not leave. If we need anything, a member of the group not involved in that weekend’s program will bring it to us. But, on one particular weekend, we ran out of something. It was the first time that I had worked on a retreat since I had joined the group. Since I wasn’t needed for the next hour or so, I volunteered to go. The leader for the weekend was okay with this and told me to “hurry.” I made my way to the grocery store, found the needed stuff and started back. The center is fairly remote, with very sparely traveled state highways leading to it. So, at one point, when I had maybe ten miles to go on one of these roads, I took advantage of the clear road and clear skies and put the pedal to the metal. And then I saw those lights. A county cop behind me. He was not the least bit nice. He wrote the ticket making sure that he told me how much the fine would be. i asked him if I could pay him the fine then (I knew that I couldn’t but my daddy had told me to always ask that.). He said no. I went back to the retreat center delivering the stuff we had needed and sharing news about the ticket. Folks in the group actually collected money to pay the $135.00 fine and as others shared of tickets that they had gotten along that road, it became apparent that the county cops knew when we would be at the center (I was no secret) and took full advantage of this to make their quotas.

I missed getting (yet another) one the other day. Coming down Highway 9 approaching Saratoga, California, I was doing at least 45, easily, in a 30 mph zone and was pulled over. The officer asked me if I knew how fast I’d been going. “No sir,” I replied. “There’s no way I had the courage to look at my speedometer. I was terrified.” He smiled, “Well, I clocked you at 43 and it seemed you were accelerating. Do you have any excuse?” “Sir, the winds were perfect, the pavement smooth as glass, the weather was flawless and it was a great ride. I guess I was just got carried away.” “Well, be careful, allright.” I did not get a ticket. Why? Because I was on my bicycle! Could I have gotten a ticket? Absolutely.

Oh! Yes! A few! 3 since becoming a Police Officer. Not paying attention to, or knowing posted speed limit. I sas speeding! I took and paid the ticket. When I was on Ambulance before we had paramedics, we often could just hold a hand and fly! I was assigned to the Fire Station that was first out for Emergency Transfers. Several times not enough blood would be sent, or something took patient stability above our Pay grade. So far as I know, I still have the record time from Lugkin to UTMB John Sealy in Galveston. Was stopped several times running emergency. Agter checking to see I really had a patient, I usually just heard, “GO!!” I got a few lectures on the way back….or from my Chief when I got back. A few engines did not survive my efforts….most people Did!

Yep. I was going along on the 4 lane state highway north of town in a torrential thunderstorm. I was going along about 68 in the 55 zone. My wife was riding with me and she suggested I slow down. I’m sure she meant for safety but I cavalierly said, “no cop is going to make a stop on the 4 lane and get soaked for his trouble.” Within about 30 seconds the lights and siren came on behind me. I got a ticket. I dont ID myself as a cop when I get stopped righteously, I would be too dang embarrassed. Plus, a cop that fanatic wouldn’t have cared a bit anyway. I just paid it.

I have only been pulled over once for speeding and ended up with a different ticket instead. As the cop was walking up he looked in the back window and noticed my son in the car seat. The straps were a little loose according to him ( we had a discussion about that) and he ticketed me for the seat instead of speeding. I had to attend a training class and my ticket was dismissed. I had removed my sons snowsuit and thought the straps were tight enough. I know better now and have had 2 more kids since with no incidents.

Got one and beat it, Went to court. After prosecutor queried the cop, my lawyer asked was the radar calibrated and where was the record? Cop said he would go next door to police dept to get records. Too late! They had rested their case and I beat it.
Yes back in the 80’. I was doing 85mph in a 45mph and no seatbelt. Luckily I was able to go to traffic school. But the seat belt ticket stayed on my recors!
Yep. I was going 76 on a 65. I was trying to pass someone who was going 60.
